result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

[MK] case called at 3:13pm
Defendant Demetrius Melrod Hill does not appear. Attorney Amber Rumpf appears in court. ADA Brookellen Teuber appears in court for State of Wisconsin.  
This case is scheduled for plea and sentencing hearing today.
The Court issues a Warrant-Body Only returnable to any Jefferson County magistrate.
recess 3:14pm
JA Review of 7/13/22 RUMS
Routed to JA/FCC for further review. (07/14) ML
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 21, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

[ma] Case called at 11:08 AM 
Defendant Demetrius Melrod Hill appears via telephone. Attorney Amber K. Rumpf appears.  Michael C. Witt appears for the State of Wisconsin.

Atty Rumpf indicates that Mr. Hill has atttempted to make a personal appearance, but was unable due to transportation issues. 
Atty Rumpf requests a plea & sentencing be scheduled. 

recess: 11:10am 
NEXT: Plea & Sentencing on 7/21/22 at 3:00pm
JA's Review of 06/16/2022 RUMS
Routed to JA/FCC for further review. (6/17/22--ma)
JAs Review of 6/7/22 RUMS

Pre-trial conference on June 29, 2022 at 09:40 am.
Status conference on July 1, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Routed to JA/FCC for further review. (06/10) ML

[MK] case called at 11:24am
Defendant Demetrius Melrod Hill in court with Attorney Amber K. Rumpf. DA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin. 
Mr. Hill waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.
Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived; the charge and maximum penalties are recited
--plea of "not guilty" is entered
--Attorney Rumpf indicates that the Defense is not requesting speedy trial, however scheduling on dates relatively soon is requested.

As to the active warrant for failure to report to sign the required Signature Bond, the Court directs Mr. Hill to go now to the Clerk of Courts Office to sign the Bond. The Warrant remains active until Mr. Hill has done so.
recess 11:28am

NEXT:   (1) Pretrial Conference on 6/29/22 at 9:40am,  (2) Status Conference on 7/1/22 at 10:30am
Extradition Forecast
Defendant may be released upon the signing of the bond [attached]
Routed to JA/FCC for further review. (5/27/22--ma)
Scheduling Order
Preliminary hearing on June 6, 2022 at 11:00 am.

[ae] case called 11:03 AM Defendant Demetrius Melrod Hill appeared by telephone. Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa in court. ADA Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
The Defendant verifies that the address and date of birth listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited
The Court will schedule Preliminary Hearing within 20 day time limit
The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint.

The Court requires $1500 Signature Bond, with conditions:
--no contact with Victim 1
--no presence at Victim 1's residence
--Defendant is to report to the Jefferson County Sheriff's Office for booking (fingerprints and photographs)

Defendant is to sign bond by 4:00 pm on 5/27/22, warrant to be issued should defendant fail to sign bond 
recess 11:08 am
NEXT: (1) Preliminary Hearing on 6/6/22 at 11:00 am
Initial appearance on May 23, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Request for an earlier court date
